scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of an unidentified Brooklyn physician, dating from 1874. The book lists patients and the ailments for which they were seen by date.Some of the more common ailments listed include malaria, bronchitis, miscarriage and "obstetrical." It also includes an alphabetical listing of patients by surname. There is also general medical information and advertisments at the front and back. At the rear of the volume, there is a listing of which patients received vaccinations and their street of residence. The volume contains a business card for Drs. Havens Brewster Bayles and William Benham Snow, Jr. of 10 8th Avenue in Brooklyn, one of whom may have been the owner of this item. The pages are bound in a leather envelope with the exterior stamped "The Physician's Hand-Book, 1874."
